page.title: 18A WALK ON THE MOORS
page.content:
Today Fisons have the right to dig peat which they sell for fertilizer and commercial plant-raising.
{ON THE MOORS 1985} When we went on the moors with Mr. Eversham, he took us down the council strip and onto the moors. To get onto the moors we had to cross a ditch. We went down a path at the side of a barley field, we crossed a small bridge and went through some trees. We walked through some bracken, which was about 5ft 6inches tall. A little farther on we came to some peat cuttings. We had walked quite a long way when we saw the holes in the ground. Where we were walking was about 4ft higher than the bottom of the holes. The holes were long trenches, like the ones in the war that soldiers used to shelter in.
